result.execSummary:
The defendant Raphael D Leazer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: BAIL APPLIED. FINE PAID IN FULL.
BAIL APPLIED. DNA PAID IN FULL.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended and aftercare.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.
Letter of apology to the officers.
Attend Victim Impact Panel.

timeConds.notes: Perhaps in the Village of Menomonee Falls or surrounding area.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raphael D Leazer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Cornerstone counseling, AODA Assessment/Driver safety, and character reference letter
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Raphael D Leazer in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense enters a no contest plea to the amended information. Court imposed the folllowing sentence:

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COURT WITHHOLDS SENTENCE:

TERM OF PROBATION: 12 MONTHS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended and her aftercare;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*Letter of apology to the officers
*Attend Victim Impact Panel
*Attend AA meetings
*Perform 40 hours of community service (perhaps in Village/Menomonee Falls or surrounding area)

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 
FINE: $883.00 (apply any bail that is posted and refund balance to poster)

1 day credit if revoked 

 

I

Hearing on August 6, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Raphael D Leazer in court with Attorney Craig Mastantuono.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.  Bound over.  Information filed.  Reading is waived.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 10, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Raphael D Leazer in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on June 12, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.    Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. COURT ORDERED A $1500.00 CASH BOND IN ADDITION TO A $2500.00 SIGNATURE BOND.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. COURT ORDERED A $1500.00 CASH BOND IN ADDITION TO A $2500.00 SIGNATURE BOND.

Defendant Raphael D Leazer in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defendant allowed a non collect call.  Hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
